Class CashRegister

java.lang.Object
  CashRegister

public class CashRegister
extends java.lang.Object

Class describing the fields and methods used by a Cash register system to calculate the total price of an item including taxes and to display that information on a receipt

Version:
v1.0 Oct 20, 2016
Author:
Vinay Punwani

 double calculateSubtotal()
          Method calculateSubtotal which calculates the subtotal of the cash register transaction by multiplying the quantity of items sold by the item price

          Method calculateTax which calculates the tax of a sale by multiplying the subtotal by the tax rate symbolic constant

public CashRegister(RetailItem newItem,
                    int newQuantitySold)

Method Detail

calculateSubtotal

public double calculateSubtotal()
Method calculateSubtotal which calculates the subtotal of the cash register transaction by multiplying the quantity of items sold by the item price

Returns:
The return value, a double, which is the product of the item quantity sold and the item price

calculateTax

public double calculateTax()
Method calculateTax which calculates the tax of a sale by multiplying the subtotal by the tax rate symbolic constant

Returns:
The return value, a double, which is the product of the tax rate and the sale subtotal

calculateTotal

public double calculateTotal()
Method calculateTotal which calculates the total sale amount through the register by adding the subtotal and the tax

Returns:
The return value, a double, the sum of the tax and subtotal from the sale transaction

getItem

public RetailItem getItem()
Method getItem which returns an item object from the RetailItem class, with the associated fields

Returns:
The return value, the RetailItem object

getQuantitySold

public int getQuantitySold()
Method getQuantitySold which returns the quantity of items sold through the cash register

Returns:
The return value, an int, the number of items sold

printSalesReceipt

public void printSalesReceipt()
Method printSalesReceipt which displays a sales receipt on the screen showing the unit price, quantity, subtotal tax amount, and total amount

setItem

public void setItem(RetailItem newItem)
Method setItem which validates and assigns a new RetailItem object reference to the item variable from a passed in object parameter

Parameters:
newItem - A parameter, the RetailItem object instantiated from the RetailItem class

setQuantitySold

public void setQuantitySold(int newQuantitySold)
Method setQuantitySold which validates and sets the new quantity of items sold through the register from a passed in parameter

Parameters:
newQuantitySold - A parameter, an int, that represents the quantity of items sold
